intro: Lesquerella hemiphysaria, commonly known as the narrowleaf lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It produces small, yellow flowers and has linear, grass-like leaves. Lesquerella hemiphysaria is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
